reviews.review: Visually it was good... except for the (spoiler alert) flashback scene with young Luke and Leia. Who approved the game like quality of their faces... seriously? It did have it's moments mostly surrounding OT characters and the retcon of the abomination that was TLJ. Of course you can't make everyone happy all the time, unless you are the creative mind behind this universe or a true fan. TLJ created too many issues that left this trilogy beyond repair.
Rise of Skywalker does what it needs to do.

It was an epic conclusion. Hands down the better film of the sequel trilogy. It would've been way better if some elements in this episode would've been addressed/introduced in previous episodes so story would be more developed and have more room to play/create. Otherwise, I think most people will be satisfied with this episode.
It was terrible. It is the worst Star Wars movie. Have seen all the other Star Wars films several times and this movie was a huge disappointment.

A starwars epic which tries it's best to give the audience an opera worthy of the fan base. Will attract new fans and demonstrates that the star wars universe is actually pretty dark. Reminiscent of KOTR... strong performances from Ridley, Driver and of course McDiarmid. Great to see a sentinel emerge!

Entire movie was damage control for the previous film. Felt like watching a YouTube video with cuts every 3 seconds. Mad Max Fury Road was a single long action scene that had more downtime than this. 

Better than Episode 8, but still worse than Episode 2, which is WILD. Grab the biggest bag of popcorn and go to a theater with booze for best results.

Great resolution to the saga! Non-stop action but still feels like Star Wars. The Emperor finally seemed as evil and powerful as he should have been all along, and Kylo Rens storyline was satisfying. Rey was truly a hero, and Luke, Leia, and Han were given fitting send offs. Damn the cynics, loved this movie!

I am no fan of Star Wars, but even I couldn't help but enjoy this one. After Rian Johnson's headache that was The Last Jedi, JJ Abrams had the difficult task of redeeming an incredibly famous series as well as end it, and he did a great job. Characters are back and as fun as ever, the story is interesting, and the conclusion was satisfying. Overall, Star Wars: Rise of Skywalker is a great conclusion to the Star Wars Saga as well as a great movie in general.
Thank you for the beautiful movie. Thank you for all memories you brought back. May the force be with you!
Good action and good for children. Ties up this leg of the story but leaves room for more stories. Family loved it as well.
